main event: A white glowing, round ball-shaped object was observed following an airliner for about three feet, trailing it without changing direction, for approximately a minute in Baltimore, Maryland on October 23, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed through 8x30 field glasses, providing a detailed view of the white glowing object.
The witness expressed skepticism about it being an astronomical phenomenon, stating they were an avid student of astronomical attractions.
The object made no change in direction but followed the airliner closely, sparking curiosity about its purpose.
The witness reported the sighting to the Baltimore Air Defence Filter Center, seeking information on the mysterious object.
Despite the witness's earnest inquiry and a subsequent request for more information, the case was considered to have insufficient data for evaluation.
